args: (That was a most fruitful journey. I've\nlearned so many forms of love that\nhumans can feel.)
Now I can finally tell Ma the truth...
I gave my daughter everything she wanted!\nRaised her with nothing but love and care!\nDo you think perhaps I...spoiled her?
I would give anything to regain custody\nof my son again...
(Love can cause misunderstandings.\nIt can cause people to hurt each other,\nas well as worry endlessly.)
I had to lie! Ma was the kindest woman\nalive—the type that always put the needs\nof others ahead of her own.
(Love leads them to support each other.)

I'm so sorry, Margaret. I gave you what I
THOUGHT you wanted because I felt it was
the right way to love you, but I never
actually asked what you REALLY wanted.
Oh, I'm sorry too, Daddy! I just wanted you\nto care about me and love me and stuff,\nand I ended up hurting you because of it.
(Love leads them to care for each other.)
Let's be a family again—all four of us.
(And love allows people to find hope.)

The future is darkness, with no way to see
forward through the gloom. But the feeling
we know as love shines through us and
helps to light the way.
But sometimes that light can be blinding,\nand cause us to stumble.
After this long journey, I finally\nunderstand what love is.
With his journey at an end, Zodiark decided to\nreturn to the Halidom in the morning. As such,\nhe closed his eyes and fell into a deep sleep.
It has been some time, Zodiark.
Though my soul became one with yours,\nI was finally able to take form in the midst\nof your slumber.
My determination must have brought about\nthis miracle—for there is something I must\nsay to you.
I wish to leave my children in your care.
And not just {player_name}—\nI want you to look over all of them.
I can be their father no longer,\nbut you can do so in my stead.
Where is this coming from, Aurelius?
You now know how I was...lacking\nas a father.

It was my failings in this department that
led you to seek out the true meaning of
love—a meaning I am happy to see you
have discovered.
And how do you know this?
Because I have been inside you\nthroughout your journey.
That is why I believe you can do what\nI could not—you can love my children\ntruly and watch over them.
I see... It is true that I can finally\nspeak with confidence on your love\nfor your children, Aurelius...

You loved your children the way you
believed was right. But your love was
lacking, for you did not think about how
they wished for you to love them.
Your love was too one-sided, and it\nbrought harm to them in the end.
I stand here ashamed and can do no\nother, for you are correct in all ways.
That is why I ask you to give them the love\nI failed to provide.
I will gladly do so for you, my friend.
You have my thanks for it.
With this, I no longer have any regrets\nand can rest within you once more.
And yet as luck would have it,\nI have my own regret to consider.
If I had spoken with you like this sooner,\nperhaps I could have been of some help\nto you and your children.
On this journey, I learned that the only\nway to form emotional connections and\nunderstand one another is to talk in depth.
Yet while I chided you for this problem,\nI failed to do so myself. I apologize.
No, Zodiark. I am at fault for closing off\nmy heart to everyone—including you.
I was afraid. I thought that if I showed you\nmy faults and weaknesses, you would lose\nyour faith in me.
So I stayed quiet. I hid my actions from\neven my trusted pactwyrm, and those\nactions brought suffering to my children.
I was a fool through and through—both\nas a father and as a pactbearer—and I can\nonly offer my sincerest apologies.
Raise your head, Aurelius.\nThe past cannot be changed.
Through this conversation, our misgivings\nof one another have been cleared, and our\nrelationship can now be forged anew.
Sleep well, Aurelius. I will see to it\nthat your feelings are known.
I leave my children in your care...\nmy most trusted pactwyrm...
Ah, but it is a beautiful morning.
It is time I returned to my master\nand fulfilled my new vow.
Leonidas, Phares, and Chelle.\nValyx, Beren, and Emile.
You all were born of my greatest friend\nAurelius, and I swear by my name that\nI will protect you always.
I swear it as one who waltzes in the black,\never vigilant and protective in your\nshadows!
